intro: Psychotria cypellantha, commonly known as the "Cypellantha Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. The plant's botanical features make it an important subject in studies of biodiversity and ecological adaptation.
